6485d7f5ec4aa9f13d5848f64b21993c (14:06): -kfo: maybe because another TERM is set?
8721d8b6567b53c49871b526aef4f504 (14:10): +It works if i run TERM=xterm in screen
6485d7f5ec4aa9f13d5848f64b21993c (14:10): -Ratty_: maybe you have a different definition of "mouse does not work" than kfo?
6485d7f5ec4aa9f13d5848f64b21993c (14:11): -I mean, I do not see a mouse cursor which is my definition of mouse works as expected ;-)
0bd36436820524a652679131b48c0b92 (14:11): +Ratty_! what version of gpm do you have?
0bd36436820524a652679131b48c0b92 (14:13): +hrm, when i :set mouse=a in screen i get:
0bd36436820524a652679131b48c0b92 (14:13): +*** err [lib/liblow.c(336)]: /dev/gpmctl: No such file or directory
0bd36436820524a652679131b48c0b92 (14:14): +but as with kfo, if i run "TERM=xterm vim" within screen, :set mouse=a works
bcb6555c8b79c4761b34412b0d9d368c (14:15): +What's your existing TERM type, and are you running this on the console or in a terminal?
bcb6555c8b79c4761b34412b0d9d368c (14:16): +Might want to have screen with the xterm term type, in that case
0bd36436820524a652679131b48c0b92 (14:19): +yeah ever looked at just how similar screen/xterm's terminfo is?
bcb6555c8b79c4761b34412b0d9d368c (14:21): +Well, colour me stupid. That's even better. :)
